definition: to have a voracious desire for/to covet/greedy/corrupt

sentences.english: The Belly-Worship Snake Game is a simple and fun game.
sentences.chinese: 貪食蛇遊戲是款簡單有趣的遊戲。

sentences.english: It turns out that the patient is bulimic and has been abusing ipecac for years.
sentences.chinese: 原來，這個病人患有貪食症，並已濫用嘔吐劑很多年。

sentences.english: Too proud art thou to kill these sweet-tooths.
sentences.chinese: 我知道你太高傲了，不會殺死這些貪食者。

sentences.english: Anorexia and bulimia become normal in a society that is striving to be slender.
sentences.chinese: 社會上，爲了變苗條厭食症和貪食症越來越普遍。

sentences.english: For years I thought he was bulimic.
sentences.chinese: 那幾年我認爲他是故意控制飲食的貪食症患者”。

sentences.english: and put a knife to your throat if you are given to gluttony.
sentences.chinese: 你若是貪食的，就當拿刀放在喉嚨上。

sentences.english: Gluttons dig their graves with their teeth.
sentences.chinese: 饞嘴貪食的人，用自己的牙齒自掘墳墓。

definition: yellow face, emaciated body (idiom); malnourished and sickly in appearance
(TCM) consumptive disease, chronic deficiency disorder due to impaired function of inner organs, deficiency of qi, blood, yin and yang/asthenia
Illness enters by the mouth (idiom). Mind what you eat!/fig. A loose tongue may cause a lot of trouble.
treatment involving the use of tonics to restore the patient's health/reinforcing method (in acupuncture)
(of food) to retain in stomach due to indigestion (TCM)
